\[ 25\% \text{ of } 180 = 0.25 \times 180 = 45 \text{ lbs} \]

Now, add this increase to the weight of the first worker to find the total weight of the two workers:
\[ 180 + 45 = 225 \text{ lbs} \]

So, the resultant maximum live load is:
\[ \boxed{225} \]

The mass of the object is approximately $1 \, \text{kg} = 1000 \, \text{m}^3 = 1000 \times 10^{-7} \, \text{kg}^3$.

The answer is:
\[ \boxed{B} \]
